meanings.definition: A machine for converting mechanical energy into electrical energy.
meanings.sent1: The dynamo in the factory powered all the lights.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic fixed the dynamo in the generator.
meanings.sent3: The dynamo in the old car had a magical ability to keep the radio playing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a dynamo, lighting up the room with energy.
meanings.sent5: The dynamo hummed as it transformed the wind's power into electricity.

meanings.definition: A person who is full of energy and enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: Sarah is a dynamo at the office, always ready to help.
meanings.sent2: The team captain was a dynamo on the field, motivating everyone.
meanings.sent3: The dynamo of the group, Tom, kept everyone laughing with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her energy was like a dynamo, never running out no matter what.
meanings.sent5: The dynamo of the party, Mark, danced all night with endless enthusiasm.

meanings.definition: A powerful and dynamic force or personality.
meanings.sent1: The new leader proved to be a dynamo, inspiring the team.
meanings.sent2: The storm was a dynamo of nature, causing chaos and change.
meanings.sent3: The dynamo of the play, the villain, stole the show with their charisma.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a dynamo, sparking a revolution in the hearts of many.
meanings.sent5: The dynamo of the protest, Maria, led with unwavering strength and passion.
